channel.title: Dave's linkblog feed
channel.description: My linkblog has been around in various locations for many years.

item.description: Welcome to Maga Lardo Senior Assisted Living.
item.source:markdown: Welcome to Maga Lardo Senior Assisted Living.

item.description: You can't hurt Bezos, so why not keep the reporters employed. They're finally doing the right thing and including us on why their pub does such puzzling things. Maybe they'll keep doing it. I don't imagine Bezos cares. I could be wrong.
item.source:markdown: You can't hurt Bezos, so why not keep the reporters employed. They're finally doing the right thing and including us on why their pub does such puzzling things. Maybe they'll keep doing it. I don't imagine Bezos cares. I could be wrong.

item.source:markdown: LLMs and the Emergence of Extended Cognition.

item.description: How Mass Deportations Would ‘Devastate’ Texas.
item.source:markdown: How Mass Deportations Would ‘Devastate’ Texas.

item.description: The NYT must think we're idiots. They're reporting the results of a freaking poll as evidence that the Democrats are slipping in NYC. Oh really. No, I think they are the actual idiots for wasting their readers' time with bullshit like this.
item.source:markdown: The NYT must think we're idiots. They're reporting the results of a freaking poll as evidence that the Democrats are slipping in NYC. Oh really. No, I think they are the actual idiots for wasting their readers' time with bullshit like this.

item.description: Wondering if there be Nazi flags at Trump's Madison Square Garden rally tomorrow.
item.source:markdown: Wondering if there be Nazi flags at Trump's Madison Square Garden rally tomorrow.

item.description: LA Times Planned ‘Case Against Trump’ Series Alongside Kamala Harris Endorsement Before Owner Quashed It.
item.source:markdown: LA Times Planned ‘Case Against Trump’ Series Alongside Kamala Harris Endorsement Before Owner Quashed It.

item.description: Finally some insight into how journalism is misdirected to avoid the wrath of fascism, in the United States, probably since 2016. Now that the window is open, keep going. Journalism dies in darkness, as we have seen.
item.source:markdown: Finally some insight into how journalism is misdirected to avoid the wrath of fascism, in the United States, probably since 2016\. Now that the window is open, keep going. Journalism dies in darkness, as we have seen.

item.description: We've relied too much on the Democrats to stick their necks out, when in fact all our necks are on the line here.
item.source:markdown: We've relied too much on the Democrats to stick their necks out, when in fact all our necks are on the line here.

item.description: If you're lookin to relax I recommend this week's Trippi podcast. He knows what the polls are saying and what they aren't.
item.source:markdown: If you're lookin to relax I recommend this week's Trippi podcast. He knows what the polls are saying and what they aren't.

item.description: Editor resigns, subscribers cancel as Washington Post non-endorsement prompts crisis at Bezos paper.
item.source:markdown: Editor resigns, subscribers cancel as Washington Post non-endorsement prompts crisis at Bezos paper.

item.description: “The decision not to publish was made by The Post’s owner — Amazon founder Jeff Bezos — according to the same sources.”
item.source:markdown: “The decision not to publish was made by The Post’s owner — Amazon founder Jeff Bezos — according to the same sources.”

item.description: Benjamin Wittes: "As a longtime member of the Washington Post editorial page staff, this genuinely shocks me."
item.source:markdown: Benjamin Wittes: "As a longtime member of the Washington Post editorial page staff, this genuinely shocks me."

item.description: If the Democrats want 10 or 20 percent of Republican voters they should stop blaming men for things they don’t control. I know people don’t want to hear this, but what if preserving democracy depends on you listening.
item.source:markdown: If the Democrats want 10 or 20 percent of Republican voters they should stop blaming men for things they don’t control. I know people don’t want to hear this, but what if preserving democracy depends on you listening.

item.description: What's preventing Harris from crushing Trump is shockingly simple.
item.source:markdown: What's preventing Harris from crushing Trump is shockingly simple.

item.description: I like reading the Atlantic. And one of the nicest things is as a subscriber I get an unlimited number of gift articles. Seems like a bit of a partnership, that isn't present with the NYT and WP, two other pubs I subscribe to have a limit of 10 per month.
item.source:markdown: I like reading the Atlantic. And one of the nicest things is as a subscriber I get an unlimited number of gift articles. Seems like a bit of a partnership, that isn't present with the NYT and WP, two other pubs I subscribe to have a limit of 10 per month.

item.description: Los Angeles Times editorials editor resigns after owner blocks presidential endorsement.
item.source:markdown: Los Angeles Times editorials editor resigns after owner blocks presidential endorsement.

item.description: At this late stage the NYT should announce that they realize this election is the last gasp for American democracy, and they played a big role in taking it down, and in penance they are shutting down, possibly permanently. If democracy survives, they might come back, begging forgiveness.
item.source:markdown: At this late stage the NYT should announce that they realize this election is the last gasp for American democracy, and they played a big role in taking it down, and in penance they are shutting down, possibly permanently. If democracy survives, they might come back, begging forgiveness.

item.description: This is the kind of story I was hoping the Washington Post would run months ago, and have it serve as background for every other story on the election. Now it’s probably too late, it’s almost a postmortem on the election.

item.description: Can you believe Bluesky could have built their system on http and rss. If it really works, what a response to ActivityPub. We’d be years ahead of where we are now. Social web devs should check this out.
item.source:markdown: Can you believe Bluesky could have built their system on http and rss. If it really works, what a response to ActivityPub. We’d be years ahead of where we are now. Social web devs should check this out.

item.description: Paul Frazee thread where he explains Blue Sky's philosophy of formats and user data. Illuminating. He says in one msg that they could have used HTTP and RSS. I wish they had. Could've saved a lot of time and confusion. They still should do it. Huge potential adoption with devs.
item.source:markdown: Paul Frazee thread where he explains Blue Sky's philosophy of formats and user data. Illuminating. He says in one msg that they could have used HTTP and RSS. I wish they had. Could've saved a lot of time and confusion. They still should do it. Huge potential adoption with devs.
